history.content: W61B is set up as part of a UC system-wide project to allow students across the UC system to take courses only offered at one particular campus or another.  It has been offered already for 2-3 fall or spring terms to non-Berkeley UC students.  As far as I know (and I may just not have been told), there are not yet any plans to either offer it during summer terms or provide access to Berkeley students (who, after all, have 61B taught to thousands of students a year in fall, spring and summer terms on campus).

Hello all, I noticed on the Berkeley course catalog that the EECS department is going to begin offering an online alternative to CS 61B that will be held during summer terms. Two questions about this:

1) Will this course begin to be offered as early as Summer 2019?

2) I live quite far from campus. Will the midterms and finals have online proctored options for those of us who are not able to attend summer term on campus?
history.subject: CS W61B
